title: Horn says Pacquiao has slipped
text:
Horn says Pacquiao has slipped By Dino Maragay (philstar.com)   2:46pm Manny Pacquiao and Jeff Horn 
MANILA, Philippines – For Australian prospect Jeff Horn, Manny Pacquiao is already ripe for the picking. 
The 28-year-old Horn may get the fight of his life against Pacquiao, whose next bout planned for April 22 might end up in Australia. 
Top Rank Inc. chief Bob Arum is already upbeat on pitting Pacquiao against Horn in Australia, which reportedly has parties interested in sponsoring the fight. 
If it pushes through, Horn will probably be the happiest person on the planet. 
Apart from getting a shot at Pacquiao’s WBO welterweight championship, Horn will have the chance to beat one of the best boxers of this generation. 
“Manny is still a great fighter, one of the greatest boxers ever. But I feel I have the skills to beat him,” Horn, rated the No. 2 welterweight by the WBO, recently told The Sunday Mail. Sportshub ( Article MRec ), pagematch: 1, sectionmatch: 1 
He said Pacquiao is already on the decline and expressed confidence that he can beat the Filipino icon. 
“He's 38 and I'm 28. He's slipped a little from his very best and I think now is a great time to challenge him,” added Horn, a 2012 Olympian who happens to be a qualified school teacher. 
The fact that the fight could possibly be staged at the Suncorp Stadium in Horn’s hometown of Brisbane will make it sweeter for the boxer. 
“I know with my home crowd behind me, I can realize my dream,” said Horn, whose record is 16-0-1, with 11 knockouts. Sportshub ( Article MRec ), pagematch: 1, sectionmatch: 1
